results.title: The Book Place

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

results.description: The Book Place was an educational TV show for children, which aired on the Seven Network from 1991 to 2003. The show was originally presented by former host of Fat Cat and Friends, Lynn Weston with Brenton Whittle, and Andy Armstrong, with Michael Scheld as the Bookworm.
description_for_label: The Book Place was an educational TV show for children, which aired on the Seven Network from 1991 to 2003. The show was originally presented by former host of Fat Cat and Friends, Lynn Weston with Brenton Whittle, and Andy Armstrong, with Michael Scheld as the Bookworm.

results.title: The Book keeper
results.brief_description: In an out of the way, old fashioned book shop, an eccentric proprietor defends his books from the predation of time, insects and occasional customers. Upstairs his crippled Granny remains addicted to tinned Irish stew and televised rock and roll wrestling until, that is , she is invaded by a bizarre literary book worm which infects her with a desire for TS Eliot. The Book Keeper loves his books and will do anything to protect them, even murder, but his tiny world is turned around when he catches his granny chewing on a few volumes of TS Eliot.

results.title: The Booby prize
results.creator_credit: Christopher Myline, British Broadcasting Corporation and Bryan Nelson
results.brief_description: Christmas Island is immensely rich in phosphate fertilizer, and is one of the finest seabird islands in the world. Phosphate mining is destroying the habitat of the seabirds, and endangering the survival of such rare species as “Abbott’s Boobies”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Myline, British Broadcasting Corporation and Bryan Nelson

results.title: The Bonne Bell Mini Marathon
results.creator_credit: Yvonne Hannemann and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: A film about the Bonne Bell Mini Marathon, an all-women event which took place in Central Park, New York. Hundreds of women of all ages took part - from serious runners to those who entered just for the enjoyment.

results.title: The Bones and muscles
results.creator_credit: Gail Prensky, JWM Productions and National Geographic Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Totally Gross Anatomy”.
Using 3D animation and x-ray footage, this video reveals the network of 206 bones and more than 600 muscles that combine to make up the human musculo-skeletal system. Students will investigate the composition of bones (the spongy inner layer, the compact outer layer and the types of marrow inside bones), and the importance of joints, tendons and muscles in ensuring that the skeleton not only gives the body a flexible framework, but also protects important internal organs. The video concludes with a series of assessment questions and answers designed to ensure that students understand basic concepts related to bones and muscles. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gail Prensky, JWM Productions and National Geographic Television

results.title: The Bomb
results.creator_credit: Pat Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: A satirical puppet films for children dealing with modern diplomacy. Two opposing embassies, anxious to obtain a nihilistic bomb, emply agents, one being Sebastian the Fox (a puppet). While the diplomats are greedily absorbed with the results they hope to achieve through possession of the bomb, Sebastian removes it. With Bruce Anderson, Lialianne Horschnad, Tom Sanders and Stephen Murray-Smith. Music by George Drefus, puppeteer Janet Van Puffelen.

results.title: The Bolshoi Theatre: 200th season
results.brief_description: First established in 1776 in Moscow, the Boilshoi Theatre has hosted 200 annual seasons of ballet and opera. This documentary celebrates the history and nostalgia of this wonderful Russian theatre in its 200th season with excerpts from several ballets and operas, along with archival stills, newsreels and commentary. Credits in Russian with English narration.

results.title: The Bolshoi Ballet in the Park
results.creator_credit: Colin Nears, Entertainment Corporation Concerts and Arts, BBC-TV, National Video Corporation and John Vernon
results.brief_description: This spectacular performance by the artists of the Bolshoi Ballet took place at the Battersea Pavilion, London in 1986 with The Orchestra of London conducted by Alexander Kopylov and artistic direction and choreography by Yuri Grigorovich. The program consisted of: 1. Les Sylphides (Chopin) - Natalia Bessmertnova, Lyudmila Semenyaka, Nina Semizorova, Alexei Fadeyechev. 2. Spartacus Act II (Khachaturian) - Eric Moukhamedov, Natalia Bessmertnova, Alexei Lazaryev, Alla Mikhalchenko. 3. Sleeping beauty (Tchaikovsky) pas de deux - Nina Araniashvili, Leonid Nikonov. 4. La Bayadere (Minkus) solo - Mikhail Tsivin. 5. Swan lake (Tchaikovsky) pas de deux - Nina Semizorova, Alexei Fadeyechev. 6. The Golden age (Shostakovich) - Natalia Bessmertnova, Erik Moukhamedov. 7. Spring waters (Rachmaninov) - Maria Bylova, Leonid Nikonov. Don Quixote (Minkus) - Lyudmila Semenyaka, Yuri Vasyuchenko, Tatiana Bessmertnova, Tatiana Golikova.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Nears, Entertainment Corporation Concerts and Arts, BBC-TV, National Video Corporation and John Vernon

results.title: The Bolero [Ed. version]
results.creator_credit: Allan Miller Productions and Allan Miller
results.brief_description: An exciting study of Ravel’s composition “Bolero” with the subtle meanings and accents polished to a brilliant interpretation by members of the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra with Zubin Mehta. The film involves the viewer in each musician’s approach to his part in individual preparation and general rehearsals prior to the final performance. It also gives some insight into Mehta’s perspective on musical values in the composition. (An edited version of Title 001358)
